  • Constructor Details

      public TerminalCard()

  • Method Details

    • getPrintCardLine

      public static String getPrintCardLine(PlayableCard card, int line, boolean printColors, TerminalCharacters terminalCharacters)
      Creates a formatted String representation of one of the Card's lines. A Card has 5 lines, because it's printed in 5 different Lines.
      Parameters:
      card - the Card to print
      line - an int value (1-5) corresponding to the Line to print
      printColors - a boolean value indicating if it needs to override the global isColorTerminalSupported or use that one instead
      Returns:
      the formatted String, in ASCII art or Emojis based on the Graphics Mode.

    • getItemPrint

      public static String getItemPrint(Item item, boolean printColors, TerminalCharacters terminalCharacters)
      Creates a String containing a representation of an Item (KingdomResource or Resource)
      Parameters:
      item - the item to print
      printColors - a boolean value indicating if it needs to override the global isColorTerminalSupported or not
      Returns:
      the String representation of the Item, in Unicode characters or Emojis depending on the Graphics Mode.

    • printCard

      public static void printCard(Card card, TerminalCharacters terminalCharacters)
      Prints a Card in its entirety by printing all the 5 lines the Card is made of.
      Parameters:
      card - the Card to print

    • printObjectiveLine

      public static String printObjectiveLine(ObjectiveCard card, int line, TerminalCharacters terminalCharacters)
      Creates and builds a formatted String containing a visual representation of one of the Lines that make up an Objective Card. Like Playable Cards, Objective Cards are also made of 5 Lines, and the one to return is passed as a parameter. The String is formatted in ASCII art or with Emojis, based on the Graphics Mode selected.
      Parameters:
      card - the Objective Card to print
      line - the Line to print
      Returns:
      the formatted String

    • color

      public static String color(String str, UiColors fg)
      Formats a String using the Unicode Color codes to print a colored output.
      Parameters:
      str - the Text that will be printed
      fg - a foreground color (text color) chosen from the UiColors enum
      Returns:
      the formatted String to print in System.out
